definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 毫[hao2]/archaic variant of 乙[yi3]
ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)

sentences.english: Melbury did not seem to be particularly enlightened by this explanation.
sentences.chinese: 麦尔布礼看来对这个解释并不很明白。

sentences.english: If there is only one deacon , he takes his place at the right of the celebrant.
sentences.chinese: 如果只有一个执事，他考虑他的位置在右边的礼。

sentences.english: Fudan University students at their graduation ceremony in Shanghai last month.
sentences.chinese: 上海复旦学子于毕上月毕业礼。

sentences.english: Janice evaded Minmei's embrace, and nodded coolly.
sentences.chinese: 贾妮斯避开了她的拥抱礼，冷淡地点点头致意。

sentences.english: Scar : Oh, I shall practise my curtsy.
sentences.chinese: 哦，我应该练习一下如何行屈膝礼。

sentences.english: "The Reeds"is obviously the epitome of this tragedy in which love succumbs to the feudal ethical code.
sentences.chinese: 《蒹葭》正是这种“爱”屈服于“礼”悲剧的缩影。

sentences.english: Etiquette is the core concept of his ideology.
Then, when an adolescent Ewok comes of age, she attends the Festival of the Hoods.
sentences.chinese: 当伊沃克人少女成龄时，要参加“成年礼”。

sentences.english: Among the functions of propriety, the most valuable is that it establishes harmony.
sentences.chinese: 礼的作用就是，待人处事以和谐为最可贵。

sentences.english: And certainly, whenever the wind blew, the Reed made the most graceful curtseys.
sentences.chinese: 这可不假，一旦起风，芦苇便行起最优雅的屈膝礼。

sentences.english: Natasha, getting up and curtseying, did not know either what she was to do.
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎站起来，行屈膝礼，她也不晓得应该怎么办。

sentences.english: The concept of ceremony is also often mixed.
sentences.chinese: 关于礼的概念，也往往淆乱不一。

sentences.english: In European cultures it is traditional for women to curtsey in front of royalty.
sentences.chinese: 在欧洲传统中，女性会向皇室成员行屈膝礼。

sentences.english: The change was rooted in the influence of Li Yue concept in North Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这一改变根源于当时礼乐观的影响。

definition: to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to accept a gift/to acknowledge greetings
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
